meanings.definition: To produce more of something than is needed or can be sold.
meanings.sent1: The factory overproduced toys, so they had to store the extras.
meanings.sent2: The company overproduced shirts, leading to a surplus of inventory.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overproduced cupcakes, causing a sweet dilemma.
meanings.sent4: The artist overproduced paintings, flooding the market with their work.
meanings.sent5: The farmer overproduced corn, filling the silos to the brim.

meanings.sent1: The overproduced goods were discounted to clear out the overstock.
meanings.sent2: The film was criticized for being overproduced with unnecessary special effects.
meanings.sent3: The play was hilariously overproduced with too many props on stage.
meanings.sent4: The cake looked overproduced with an abundance of frosting and decorations.
meanings.sent5: The event felt overproduced with excessive decorations and elaborate lighting.
